#Text=Live As a Gandhian
#Text=Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi , also known as Mahatma Gandhi , was a famous figure who helped lead India to independence .
#Text=After returning to India after studying in South Africa , Gandhi began spreading his philosophy , and many Gandhian ideas are still taught and followed to this day .
#Text=This wikiHow will take you through some core tenets of Gandhian philosophy , and help you live as a Gandhian .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Learning About Gandhism
#Text=Learn about Gandhi .
#Text=Learning about Gandhi and how he lives his life can help you learn how to better live as a Gandhian , as Gandhi exemplifies the values outlined below .
#Text=Read Gandhi 's works .
#Text=Read through Gandhi 's works and discourses to familiarize yourself with Gandhian philosophy .
#Text=Some books to consider reading include :
#Text=The Story of My Experiments with Truth is Gandhi 's autobiography , and a must-read for anyone wishing to learn about Gandhism .
#Text=In it , Gandhi writes about his life and how he developed his ideas .
#Text=Discourses on the Gita is a book written by Gandhi that deals with faith and one 's relationship with God .
#Text=If you 're planning on reading this , be sure to read the Bhagwad Gita first .
#Text=The Words of Gandhi was written by the director of the award winning movie Gandhi and is a compilation of essays , letters , and discourses by Gandhi .
#Text=Living By Gandhian Principles
#Text=Prioritize means over ends .
#Text=Gandhi strongly believed in the primacy of means over ends .
#Text=Even the noblest goal must be pursued only through the right means , even if it means it takes longer to achieve .
#Text=For instance , Gandhi highly valued nonviolence , and chose to attain his goals only through nonviolent means .
#Text=Before taking any hasty action , ask yourself - am I going about this the right way ?
#Text=Can I be sure that my action does not violate the fundamental principles of truth and nonviolence ?
#Text=Do n't avoid concerning yourself with ends altogether .
#Text=The realization of truth and pursuit of Brahman are not incompatible with pursuing noble goals .
#Text=Center your life around the search for satya , or Truth .
#Text=Gandhian philosophy lays heavy emphasis on searching for the truth and centering your life around it .
#Text=The realization of Truth , according to Gandhi , comes from devoting your life to the search for truth , even at the expense of other worldly things .
#Text=Avoid falling prey to material pleasures .
#Text=While they may be tempting , such things only distract one from the search for Truth .
#Text=Practice meditation .
#Text=Meditating helps you focus and be at peace with yourself , and aids the search for Truth .
#Text=Practice Ahimsa or Nonviolence .
#Text=The idea of nonviolence is central to Gandhi 's philosophy .
#Text=Throughout his fight for independence , Gandhi stressed the importance of passive and nonviolent forms of resistance .
#Text=Ahimsa is not limited to action alone - Gandhians must cause no harm to any living creature , in thought or in deed .
#Text=Transition to a Vegetarian Lifestyle , if you have n't already , so as to not indirectly hurt other living creatures .
#Text=Practice Brahmacharya .

#Text=Brahmacharya , or the search for Brahma , is a complex concept that preaches celibacy , faith in God , and a mastery over one 's own actions such that one does not fall prey to the pleasures of the flesh .
#Text=To practice Brahmacharya is to renounce activities that have no place in the path to Brahma .
#Text=Practice fasting .
#Text=To Gandhi , fasting was a way to cleanse and discipline the mind , body , and soul .
#Text=It helps develop the mental fortitude necessary to practice Gandhi 's teachings .
#Text=Gandhi himself fasted several times in his lifetime .
#Text=Respect all religions .
#Text=Gandhi believed in religious pluralism as a way of uniting people .
#Text=Be open to all belief systems and respect them all .
#Text=Teach yourself to be self sufficient .
#Text=Gandhi 's ideas of swarajya , which he outlined in his work Hind Swaraj , emphasize self-sufficiency and independence .
#Text=Some ideas -
#Text=Learning to sew your own clothes can be a great first step .
#Text=Gandhi used a spinning wheel , or charkha , to make khadi , a kind of homemade cloth .
#Text=Grow your own food .
#Text=Gandhi was against the industrialization that makes most of our ready-to-eat food possible , so try to grow your own produce to use while cooking .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Learning to cut back on material desires can be hard .
#Text=Take it slowly and eliminate vices not conducive to Gandhism step by step .
#Text=Watch films and documentaries on the life of Gandhi to learn more about him , such as Gandhi by Richard Attenborough .
#Text=Do n't confuse ' Truth ' ( capital t ) , the summation of all knowledge , with factual truth ( small t ) !
